Bug.Summery: Problem with library containers under MacOS X [build path]
Bug.WithStack:
MacOS X doesn't have a single rt.jar but a classes.jar and an ui.jar. The MacOS X launcher correctly detects this and it can be verified on the "Installed JRE" preference page that there are two libraries per JRE. I20020917. However when creating a new Java project, not both libraries are added to the project, but only the first one: "classes.jar". This works as long as no UI (AWT or Swing) classes are used. If UI classes are used, the user has to go to the "Advanced.." dialog in Properties/Java Build Path/Libraries, pick the "JRE System Library" option from the popup-menu and then delete the now obsolete JRE_LIB entry. This seems to be not very inuitive for the standard case. Is there a way to enable the library container by default on MacOS X so that both libraries are added to a project? Preference page 'Java->New projects' lets you configure which kind of classpath entry is added as JRE entry. Currently by default it is the JRE variable.
For 2.1 we should set it to JRE container.
If you want to force this for 2.0 and you have a plugin knowing jdt.ui, modify JDT Ui's preference store and set PreferenceConstants.NEWPROJECT_JRELIBRARY_INDEX to 1 (now its 0) *** Bug 22750 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** fixed for > 20021126
Bug.WithOutStack:
MacOS X doesn't have a single rt.jar but a classes.jar and an ui.jar. The MacOS X launcher correctly detects this and it can be verified on the "Installed JRE" preference page that there are two libraries per JRE. I20020917. However when creating a new Java project, not both libraries are added to the project, but only the first one: "classes.jar". This works as long as no UI (AWT or Swing) classes are used. If UI classes are used, the user has to go to the "Advanced.." dialog in Properties/Java Build Path/Libraries, pick the "JRE System Library" option from the popup-menu and then delete the now obsolete JRE_LIB entry. This seems to be not very inuitive for the standard case. Is there a way to enable the library container by default on MacOS X so that both libraries are added to a project? Preference page 'Java->New projects' lets you configure which kind of classpath entry is added as JRE entry. Currently by default it is the JRE variable.
For 2.1 we should set it to JRE container.
If you want to force this for 2.0 and you have a plugin knowing jdt.ui, modify JDT Ui's preference store and set PreferenceConstants.NEWPROJECT_JRELIBRARY_INDEX to 1 (now its 0) *** Bug 22750 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** fixed for > 20021126

Bug.Summery: Notification at the Resource level
Bug.WithStack: It is much easier to listen for changes using a single "domain" listener. In EMF's case, I believe a domain is approximately a Resource. I would like to be able to add a listener to a resource that receives notifications for all changes to any of the contents of the resource. We added class EContentAdapter for this. Move to verified as per bug 206558.
Bug.WithOutStack: It is much easier to listen for changes using a single "domain" listener. In EMF's case, I believe a domain is approximately a Resource. I would like to be able to add a listener to a resource that receives notifications for all changes to any of the contents of the resource. We added class EContentAdapter for this. Move to verified as per bug 206558.

Bug.Summery: Launch view "resume" icon is misleading
Bug.WithStack:
The "resume" icon in the launch view has inexplicably changed.
The new icon is "wrong" insofar as it breaks the "VCR" analogy. The new icon is used in many home media players to mean "step" or "slow play." The meaning of the old icon was more intuitive. This is the icon that will be used in the WSAD debugger in 2.1, given to us by the artist. We are using it to be consistent. To me, it looks like a "resume" button. Closing.

The "resume" icon in the launch view has inexplicably changed.
The new icon is "wrong" insofar as it breaks the "VCR" analogy. The new icon is used in many home media players to mean "step" or "slow play." The meaning of the old icon was more intuitive. This is the icon that will be used in the WSAD debugger in 2.1, given to us by the artist. We are using it to be consistent. To me, it looks like a "resume" button. Closing.

Bug.Summery: [Viewers] PR: add public method TableViewer.applyEditorValue()
Move To Top Level: request option to specify this as final field
Bug.WithStack: If the inner class was not static, the outer class is passed to the constructor of the inner class and is assigned to a field. I'd like to have the option to make this field final. This should be the default. The user can always weaken the constraint by removing the final modifier. I also think that the using the final modifier is semantically 'closer' to the pre-refactoring state. good idea fixed verified in 20021113 w2k
Bug.WithOutStack: If the inner class was not static, the outer class is passed to the constructor of the inner class and is assigned to a field. I'd like to have the option to make this field final. This should be the default. The user can always weaken the constraint by removing the final modifier. I also think that the using the final modifier is semantically 'closer' to the pre-refactoring state. good idea fixed verified in 20021113 w2k

Bug.WithStack:
Since "top level" simply means "not inner", it should be possible to move an inner class to the top level within the same compilation unit.
An alternative is to change the name of the refactoring and not to support it. both option possible opt for the latter :-) will do sth for 2.2 reop will change name fixed

Since "top level" simply means "not inner", it should be possible to move an inner class to the top level within the same compilation unit.

Bug.Summery: Generated get method ignores trailing "is", set method not [code manipulation]
Bug.WithStack:
When generating getter and setter methods for a boolean member "isFoo", Eclipse generates a method "isFoo" and a method "setIsFoo". Many applications working with bean introspection will not be able to detect this as the same property. Eclipse should either generate "isIsFoo"/"setIsFoo" or "isFoo"/"setFoo". fixed > 20021119
the accessor names are now
isFoo setFoo
Bug.WithOutStack:
When generating getter and setter methods for a boolean member "isFoo", Eclipse generates a method "isFoo" and a method "setIsFoo". Many applications working with bean introspection will not be able to detect this as the same property. Eclipse should either generate "isIsFoo"/"setIsFoo" or "isFoo"/"setFoo". fixed > 20021119
the accessor names are now
isFoo setFoo

This is true but extremely unlikely.

Bug.WithStack:
Build 20020917
When you create a plugin project it is possible to put invalid characters into the provider name field.
STEPS 1) Select New->Project->Plugin project 2) enter <</>> as the provider name 30 Project is creat with an XML error This is true but extremely unlikely. This one was fixed a long time ago.
Character like '<' is substituted with < when we write the xml file.

Character like '<' is substituted with < when we write the xml file.

Bug.Summery: Move To Top Level: compile error in corner case[refactoring]
AST: DCR: getSourcePath
Bug.WithStack:
20020917
A ITypeBinding can be asked if it is from source (isFromSource). I now need to find this source file. It is possible to do this using IJavaProject and search for the type. However, as the compiler already knows the path, it would be convenient if a method 'getSourceFilePath' would exist. API question should be sent to Jim. A binding doesn't remember where it came from. A source lookup action need to be perfomed using existing JavaModel API:
IJavaProject#findType(String packageName, String typeQualifiedName) throws JavaModelException;
Isn't this enough ? That's how I do it, it works. I was thinking the binding would know the source location (it knows that it's from source), so we could avoid eventual problems with findType not finding a non public top level typ. As I said, the binding doesn't keep this information. Ok to close? closing

Bug.Summery: AST: CompilationUnit.findDeclaringNode only finds bindings from its own ast

source_code.code:
/** * Finds the corresponding AST node in the given compilation unit from * which the binding with the given key originated. Returns * null if the corresponding node cannot be determined. * This method always returns null if bindings were not requested * when this AST was built. *

* The following table indicates the expected node type for the various * different kinds of binding keys: *

    *
  • *
  • package - a PackageDeclaration
    • *
  • class or interface - a TypeDeclaration or a * ClassInstanceCreation (for anonymous classes)
    • *
  • primitive type - none
    • *
  • array type - none
    • *
  • field - a VariableDeclarationFragment in a * FieldDeclaration
    • *
  • local variable - a SingleVariableDeclaration, or * a VariableDeclarationFragment in a * VariableDeclarationStatement or * VariableDeclarationExpression
    • *
  • method - a MethodDeclaration
    • *
  • constructor - a MethodDeclaration
    • *
*

* * @param key the binding key, or null * @return the corresponding node where a binding with the given * key is declared, or null if the key is null * or if the key does not correspond to a node in this compilation unit * or if bindings were not requested when this AST was built * @see IBinding#getKey * @since 2.1 */

Lines.Line: 1. CU A has a expression that has a TypeBinding to a type in CU B.
I need to get the type declaration in B
2. I create an AST for B and do CompilationUnit.findDeclaringNode(typeBinding).
Unfortunatly, the binding is not found: It seems typeBinding.equals goes for
identity, but is not comparing keys.
TypeBinding equals is using the Object's implementation. I will see how to
improve this.
This method is only intended to be used to retrieve declaring node from a
binding created in the same compilation unit.
Jim - we might want to propose a new mecanism to achieve this.
Keys are our general mechanism for relating bindings arising from one AST to
those from another AST. This suggests adding a new API method
CompilationUnit.findDeclaringNode(String key) so that a binding key can be
used to do the lookup. Martin: would like solve your problem?
That would solve the problem!
Added API method; marked it @since 2.1; added other minor clarifications.
Ignore previous comment. We won't add the method until implementation is ready.
Here is the API spec for the new method:

Bug.WithStack:
20020917 1. CU A has a expression that has a TypeBinding to a type in CU B. I need to get the type declaration in B 2. I create an AST for B and do CompilationUnit.findDeclaringNode(typeBinding). Unfortunatly, the binding is not found: It seems typeBinding.equals goes for identity, but is not comparing keys. TypeBinding equals is using the Object's implementation. I will see how to improve this. This method is only intended to be used to retrieve declaring node from a binding created in the same compilation unit. Jim - we might want to propose a new mecanism to achieve this. Keys are our general mechanism for relating bindings arising from one AST to those from another AST. This suggests adding a new API method CompilationUnit.findDeclaringNode(String key) so that a binding key can be used to do the lookup. Martin: would like solve your problem? That would solve the problem! Added API method; marked it @since 2.1; added other minor clarifications. Ignore previous comment. We won't add the method until implementation is ready. Here is the API spec for the new method: /** * Finds the corresponding AST node in the given compilation unit from * which the binding with the given key originated. Returns * null if the corresponding node cannot be determined. * This method always returns null if bindings were not requested * when this AST was built. *

* The following table indicates the expected node type for the various * different kinds of binding keys: *

    *
  • *
  • package - a PackageDeclaration
    • *
  • class or interface - a TypeDeclaration or a * ClassInstanceCreation (for anonymous classes)
    • *
  • primitive type - none
    • *
  • array type - none
    • *
  • field - a VariableDeclarationFragment in a * FieldDeclaration
    • *
  • local variable - a SingleVariableDeclaration, or * a VariableDeclarationFragment in a * VariableDeclarationStatement or * VariableDeclarationExpression
    • *
  • method - a MethodDeclaration
    • *
  • constructor - a MethodDeclaration
    • *
*

* * @param key the binding key, or null * @return the corresponding node where a binding with the given * key is declared, or null if the key is null * or if the key does not correspond to a node in this compilation unit * or if bindings were not requested when this AST was built * @see IBinding#getKey * @since 2.1 */ public ASTNode findDeclaringNode(String key) When this method is added, the Javadoc for the other method should be changed to add: * Use findDeclaringNode(binding.getKey()) when the binding comes * from a different AST. and * @see #findDeclaringNode(java.lang.String) Is this urgent? In the next weeks, I will spend time on the DOM side only if the bug needs to be fixed asap, otherwise I will defer its resolution. Jim - put the previous version of CompilationUnit as an attachement. You had a change to the findDeclaringNode(IBinding) method API as well. As soon as the implementation is ready I will release the version attached to this PR in the same time. Ok, I released it. If you find any problem with it, reopen it or create a new bug. Fixed and released in 2.1 stream. Regression tests added. Verified.

Accessibility: Control+SPACE doesn't work in Eclipse
Bug.WithStack:
Control+Space is supposed to toggle Tree and Table selection for keyboard users. If the Java Editor is open, it doesn't work. The accelerator is consumed, even when the Navigator or other Views are active.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 20150 ***
Bug.WithOutStack:
Control+Space is supposed to toggle Tree and Table selection for keyboard users. If the Java Editor is open, it doesn't work. The accelerator is consumed, even when the Navigator or other Views are active.

Bug.Summery: improper layout of table columns using ColumnWeightData
Bug.WithStack:
The first column occupies most of the available width thus hiding the rest of the columns thus creating a horizontal scroll bar. The proportions are still valid but they no longer fit within the display area. This is a regression from the previous version.
Workaround: Use ColumnPixelData and Specify size explicitly. Could you give a nexample of this behaviour? Does it occur within anything we ship?
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 23349 ***
Bug.WithOutStack:
The first column occupies most of the available width thus hiding the rest of the columns thus creating a horizontal scroll bar. The proportions are still valid but they no longer fit within the display area. This is a regression from the previous version.
Workaround: Use ColumnPixelData and Specify size explicitly. Could you give a nexample of this behaviour? Does it occur within anything we ship?
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 23349 ***

Bug.Summery: ScrollBar page increment should be calculated
Bug.WithStack: ScrollBar currently has an arbitrary page increment value (20 pixels). This value should be calculated from the client area and the size of the view. And this value should be updated whenever the scrollpane or view contents change size. In ScrollPaneLayout.layout(IFigure), I now set the page increment to be the extent of the scrollbar thumb (which should be equivalent to one page).
Bug.WithOutStack: ScrollBar currently has an arbitrary page increment value (20 pixels). This value should be calculated from the client area and the size of the view. And this value should be updated whenever the scrollpane or view contents change size. In ScrollPaneLayout.layout(IFigure), I now set the page increment to be the extent of the scrollbar thumb (which should be equivalent to one page).

Bug.Summery: Quick Fix: Should feature a 'create constructor' similar to 'create method'
[Team UI] Automatic turning on/off autobuild with import team project set
Bug.WithStack:
Whenver I do Import "Team Project Set" each module is rebuilt after it is brought into the Workspace. This eats up a lot of time and has brought Eclipse to a crawl on large Team Project Sets. (Since the team project sets is sorted the same as the projects (alphabetically) some base modules are done last causing many no desired recompiles (with errors) until the project set is completely reloaded).
The workaround is to go to 'Window->Preferences->Worskpace->"Perform build automatically on resource modifications"' and disable it prior to the import ant then to re-enable it after the import.
Ideally, I would like the option to make this automatic during an import of a team project set (if it is enabled to disable it during the import).
An addition or alternate to this enhancement request would be to provide this preference setting as a stateful toggle button on the main gui. This would make it easier to enable and disable and would make it more obvious the current setting. We need to do the entire import in a workspace runnable. The CVS portion looks to be done in a workspace runnable so this behavior should only happen when using another or multiple repository providers. Is this the case? Fix releasd to HEAD
Bug.WithOutStack:
Whenver I do Import "Team Project Set" each module is rebuilt after it is brought into the Workspace. This eats up a lot of time and has brought Eclipse to a crawl on large Team Project Sets. (Since the team project sets is sorted the same as the projects (alphabetically) some base modules are done last causing many no desired recompiles (with errors) until the project set is completely reloaded).
The workaround is to go to 'Window->Preferences->Worskpace->"Perform build automatically on resource modifications"' and disable it prior to the import ant then to re-enable it after the import.
Ideally, I would like the option to make this automatic during an import of a team project set (if it is enabled to disable it during the import).
An addition or alternate to this enhancement request would be to provide this preference setting as a stateful toggle button on the main gui. This would make it easier to enable and disable and would make it more obvious the current setting. We need to do the entire import in a workspace runnable. The CVS portion looks to be done in a workspace runnable so this behavior should only happen when using another or multiple repository providers. Is this the case? Fix releasd to HEAD

Bug.WithStack:
PH_QUERY_GRAPHICS should be used instead of Ph_QUERY_WORKSPACE. This does not seem right. Device.getClientArea() is supposed to return the area of the display excluding the "trimmings" (such as desktop shelves). Alright - I guess I have getBounds() and getClientArea() mixed up. The javadocs are not very clear on the difference in their purpose.
SSQ, is there anything to do here? If not close. Closing.

Bug.Summery: Input group is hardcoded as 1 in PhWindowQueryVisible()
Bug.WithStack:
Every call to PhWindowQueryVisible() needs to be changed to pass PhInputGroup (0) instead of 1. Where did 1 come from anyway? Created attachment 2021 Always call PhInputGroup (Shell, Device, Tracker) The attached patch changes the query rectangle in Device.java. Attaching a new one to keep these issue apart.
Created attachment 2022 Correction to original patch. Chris, we won't make a change unless we know why we are making it. Can you tell us what the "1" was and what bug the new code is fixing? The value of 1 happens to be what the call to PhInputGroup(0) will return today. However, I don't think you should use hard-coded values when you don't have to use hard-coded values. This could change in the future. Fixed > 20020919.

This could change in the future. Fixed > 20020919.

Bug.Summery: Default font should be "TextFont8"
Bug.WithStack:
The default on Photon is TextFont09, but this makes Eclipse look ugly. We should change this to be "TextFont8". SN and SSQ have explored some apps that come with QNX6.2 (Helpviewer, PhAB, ped, voyager). It seems that these apps use a mixture of TextFont09 and TextFont8. Setting the default font especially to hardcoded value is dangerous and we go to great lengths on other platforms not to do this. Yes, there is a mix. You will notice too that not all widgets in my patch have been modified (tabfolder for example is left alone, as are menus and menuitems). Unfortunatly SWT doesn't have a properties file for setting font resources (like jface) and photon doesn't have a single default font nor a way to query a user-selectable font size from the system. However, our UI guy thinks this is the right font to be using and is what all the "new" applications are using. The old default of TextFont9 and querying the button widget (which gives back TextFont9) results in a great deal of wasted screen space.
Created attachment 2019 Update to Font.java to change default font to TextFont8. Going to open an additional bug for the case of setting up TEXT_FONT and LIST_FONT. This keeps the changes to Font.java (this bug) and Display.java (new bug) separate.
Created bug #23807 to cover changes to Display.java
These two patches address the same issue.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 23807 ***

Bug.Summery: [Webapp] Mozilla not restored from minimized when launching help.
Bug.WithStack: Whe Mozilla browser is running, but is minimized, launching help caused the help page to load in the browser, but the browser remains minimized. It is difficult to know that document loaded in the browser, when onlytext on the Mozilla icon in the teskbar has changed. If users misses that and does not restore the mozilla window, they will get imression that nothing happened and help does not work. Netscape 4 does not have this problem. Adding -raise option when launching Mozilla does not help. This is a bug in mozilla. See http://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi? id=159092. There is a workaround to execute javascript:window.focus() in Mozilla. This has efect of restoring the window from minimized, and also bringing the window forward. Incorporated a workaround into our code. +1 The workaround has been removed before 2.1RC4 because it had side effects (bug 35412). *** Bug 44906 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Marking as P4 - unlikely to be looked at for 3.1. This is not a problem with Firefox so I'm going to close out this bug report. The bug is presumably still there if you have an old enough browser but the typical user will not run into this bug.
Bug.WithOutStack: Whe Mozilla browser is running, but is minimized, launching help caused the help page to load in the browser, but the browser remains minimized. It is difficult to know that document loaded in the browser, when onlytext on the Mozilla icon in the teskbar has changed. If users misses that and does not restore the mozilla window, they will get imression that nothing happened and help does not work. Netscape 4 does not have this problem. Adding -raise option when launching Mozilla does not help. This is a bug in mozilla. See http://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi? id=159092. There is a workaround to execute javascript:window.focus() in Mozilla. This has efect of restoring the window from minimized, and also bringing the window forward. Incorporated a workaround into our code. +1 The workaround has been removed before 2.1RC4 because it had side effects (bug 35412). *** Bug 44906 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Marking as P4 - unlikely to be looked at for 3.1. This is not a problem with Firefox so I'm going to close out this bug report. The bug is presumably still there if you have an old enough browser but the typical user will not run into this bug.

Bug.Summery: Order of args is wrong Control.setFont()
Bug.WithStack:
Pt_ARG_TITLE_FONT should be first in the list. We don't see any reason the order needs to change. Chris? This doesn't need to change. This is actually a left-over from when I originally was doing the font manipulation in the SWT shared library. Since I learned that as a no-no I moved it all into Java code.
However - not all widgets support all three font resources and it is pretty hacky to ask for all three and check for null's/0's. Just something to think about for the future now I suppose.
Ok, closing this PR. Try to make sure your patches only include code that addresses the problem. Closing.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Pt_ARG_TITLE_FONT should be first in the list. We don't see any reason the order needs to change. Chris? This doesn't need to change. This is actually a left-over from when I originally was doing the font manipulation in the SWT shared library. Since I learned that as a no-no I moved it all into Java code.
However - not all widgets support all three font resources and it is pretty hacky to ask for all three and check for null's/0's. Just something to think about for the future now I suppose.
Ok, closing this PR. Try to make sure your patches only include code that addresses the problem. Closing.

Bug.Summery: Quick Fix: 'add throws clause' creates a new problem
Groups don't look like the platform
Bug.WithStack:
There should be no gradient on the title, no borders and the font should be bold. There aren't many group boxes used by Photon apps. The only ones we could find on QNX 6.2 were in voyager "Edit->Preferences" and PhAB "Application->Startup Info/Modules...". The SWT group boxes look the same as these. The proposed look is "better", but is it right? We should probably do this, as there seems to be no standard. I am going based on the feedback I have from our UI guy. Just for future reference, the current version of PhAB and Helpviewer are not good examples of how the UI in the system should be done. Internally PhAB has been totally re- done and Helpviewer in in line for something soon.
Created attachment 2018 Patch to Group widget for look-n-feel update. Is there any UI guidelines from QNX that we can follow? Since this change is less dangerous than changing the system font, we should consider it. Could not the next version of Photon have the right look by default? In general we don't use the title area of containers at all. So the default look for a PtGroup widget is nothing on the screen at all. This won't change since it is used a great deal within PhAB to group widgets together logically rather then visually. As for a set of UI guidelines, nothing currently. That is why I am working on things. Fixed > 20020923.
Chris, please browse the changes that implement the look you want. Run the ControlExample to see how this looks in apps other than Eclipse. Can you show this to your "GUI guy" to make sure this is the look he is after. We think that the missing border around the group box looks funny, but obviuosly QNX has the last word.
Silenio and Steve

Bug.Summery: Label.setFont() needs to check "text != null"
Bug.WithStack:
We look at the code and we believe there is no way this field can be null. Chris? I put in the check because the call to setText() will throw an exception if the value is null. I am not sure how it gets set to null, but if you call setFont() instead of super.setFont() in createHandle() then it will be NULL and will throw an exception. I left the check in since I was able to hit it during my testing.
The rule in SWT is to know when variables can be null and when they can never be null. So, null checks have a meaning. I believe you needed this check because of the way you wrote your patch for the "make default Photon font smaller" problem (you call the public API setFont() before the widget is created). This is an indication that the code in the patch is structured incorrectly. Fair enough. Reject the bug. :)
Closing.
Bug.WithOutStack:
We look at the code and we believe there is no way this field can be null. Chris? I put in the check because the call to setText() will throw an exception if the value is null. I am not sure how it gets set to null, but if you call setFont() instead of super.setFont() in createHandle() then it will be NULL and will throw an exception. I left the check in since I was able to hit it during my testing.
The rule in SWT is to know when variables can be null and when they can never be null. So, null checks have a meaning. I believe you needed this check because of the way you wrote your patch for the "make default Photon font smaller" problem (you call the public API setFont() before the widget is created). This is an indication that the code in the patch is structured incorrectly. Fair enough. Reject the bug. :)
Closing.

Bug.Summery: [CVS CVSNT] Support :server: connection type to CVS
Bug.WithStack: Eclipse supports pserver, ext, and extssh now but it also needs to support 'server' which would mean a built-in rsh client. This is needed because there is no rsh client available that works on Windows (the system one does cr/lf translation which messes up Eclipse's communication with CVS). This bug has not been touched in 2 years. Closing as WONTFIX. If you feel this bug is important, feel free to reopen it. Memory is fuzzy on this but obviously we worked around it somehow. Ok to close.
Bug.WithOutStack: Eclipse supports pserver, ext, and extssh now but it also needs to support 'server' which would mean a built-in rsh client. This is needed because there is no rsh client available that works on Windows (the system one does cr/lf translation which messes up Eclipse's communication with CVS). This bug has not been touched in 2 years. Closing as WONTFIX. If you feel this bug is important, feel free to reopen it. Memory is fuzzy on this but obviously we worked around it somehow. Ok to close.

Bug.Summery: control example: Combo SWT.BORDER checkbox cannot be selected
Bug.WithStack:
integration build 09/17
On the Combo tab, trying to check the BORDER checkbox always immediately unchecks it, regardless of the values of the other controls on the tab. This is the correct behavior on all platforms. The combo box draws a border but does not use the standard mechanism so it really has no SWT.BORDER despite the fact that is draws this way The BORDER checkbox doesn't exist on the Combo page anymore since it's not a valid style.
Bug.WithOutStack:
integration build 09/17
On the Combo tab, trying to check the BORDER checkbox always immediately unchecks it, regardless of the values of the other controls on the tab. This is the correct behavior on all platforms. The combo box draws a border but does not use the standard mechanism so it really has no SWT.BORDER despite the fact that is draws this way The BORDER checkbox doesn't exist on the Combo page anymore since it's not a valid style.

I think some countries can only obtain "crippled" JDKs like that due to US export control restrictions. You can't run Eclipse with such a JDK. One thing you can check... in your JDK install, look for a file:
jre/lib/security/java.security
Make sure that it has a line like this:
security.provider.1=sun.security.provider.Sun
This sets "Sun" as your cryptography provider. This is usually the default for a Sun JDK but perhaps it has been turned off in your JDK.
Also try downloading a new VM.

Bug.Summery: [Team UI] Project set export should incorporate working sets
Bug.WithStack: It would be helpfull to allow the user to select projects to export into the set by choosing a working set. It would be also be helpful to have "Select All" and "Deselect all" buttons. This bug has not been touched in 2 years. Closing as WONTFIX. If you feel this bug is important, feel free to reopen it.

Bug.Summery: NPE - variable details stop showing

Lines.Line: (1) Use project of associated type that was selected in the details preference.
(2) Use source lookup to find the type, and use the associated project.
Option (2) is likely better, as the user does not have to select a type in (1).
I.e. they may just type in a qualified name.
oops - source lookup requires a stack frame, not a type name. Hmmm.
I thought that a project was always associated to a java launch config.
- I have to use the method DebugUITools.getDebugContext(), which return the
context only if it is call in the UI thread.
- As the requests for detail of values are put in the queue, the context may be
different between when the request is done and when the detail is evaluated.

Bug.WithStack:
I noticed that details were no longer showing for my selected variable, and found this in the console:
java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Path.append(Path.java(Compiled Code)) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.WorkspaceRoot.getProject(Workspac eRoot.java(Compiled Code)) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JavaDetailFormattersManager.getValu eDetail(JavaDetailFormattersManager.java:123) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JDIModelPresentation$3.run(JDIModel Presentation.java:1486) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:512) java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Path.append(Path.java(Compiled Code)) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.WorkspaceRoot.getProject(Workspac eRoot.java(Compiled Code)) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JavaDetailFormattersManager.getValu eDetail(JavaDetailFormattersManager.java:123) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JDIModelPresentation$3.run(JDIModel Presentation.java:1486) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:512) java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Path.append(Path.java(Compiled Code)) at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.WorkspaceRoot.getProject(Workspac eRoot.java(Compiled Code)) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JavaDetailFormattersManager.getValu eDetail(JavaDetailFormattersManager.java:123) at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JDIModelPresentation$3.run(JDIModel Presentation.java:1486) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:512) The code looks like:
try { projectName= debugTarget.getLaunch().getLaunchConfiguration ().getAttribute(IJavaLaunchConfigurationConstants.ATTR_PROJECT_NAME, (String) null); } catch (CoreException e) { throw new DebugException(e.getStatus()); } IJavaProject project= JavaCore.create(root.getProject(projectName));
The problem is that a launch config does not have to be associated with a project (as RuntimeWorkbench configs, are not).
Options: (1) Use project of associated type that was selected in the details preference. (2) Use source lookup to find the type, and use the associated project. Option (2) is likely better, as the user does not have to select a type in (1). I.e. they may just type in a qualified name. oops - source lookup requires a stack frame, not a type name. Hmmm. I thought that a project was always associated to a java launch config.
I think (2) should work, as we can get a stack frame from a view (launch view may be).
I'm going to check how we get the stack frame for the display view and the detail pane. Yes, source lookup should work... get the stack frame, then get the source element (CU or Classfile) for the stack frame, and get the Java project from that frame. That should be sufficient for a compilation context. If you cannot get a project context, you can just do the standard 'toString()'. I implemented that. There is just one 'problem', I have to put the code which determine the current project in JDIModelePresentation. Two reasons for that : - I have to use the method DebugUITools.getDebugContext(), which return the context only if it is call in the UI thread. - As the requests for detail of values are put in the queue, the context may be different between when the request is done and when the detail is evaluated.
btw, I haven't seen anything which remove a request from the queue if it is no longer valid. Is it normal ? Fixed.
Changes in JDIModelPresentation and JavaDetailFormattersManager please verify Verified.

Bug.Summery: [Workbench] Not checking for a null value when using PlatformUI.getWorkbench()

Lines.Line: 1- I subclassed ElementTreeSelectionDialog to customize it to my application,
let's call it MySelectionDialog.
2- I created an instance of ISelectionStatusValidator and setValidator() of
MySelectionDialog to be that instance.
3- In my stand-alone SWT application (it's not a plugin), whenever I say
dialog.open() I get the following:

Bug.WithStack:
In the method findImage() in org.eclipse.ui.internal.MessageLine, PlatformUI.getWorkbench() is used witout checking if the return value is null or not. This resulted a NullPointerException when SelectionStatusDialog is used. PlatformUI.getWorkbench() should never return null.
If you can, please provide steps to reproduce this problem. If you can't reproduce it, give as much detail as possible. Actually, this behavior is consistant. I get it every time I bring up my selection dialog.
Here are the steps: 1- I subclassed ElementTreeSelectionDialog to customize it to my application, let's call it MySelectionDialog. 2- I created an instance of ISelectionStatusValidator and setValidator() of MySelectionDialog to be that instance. 3- In my stand-alone SWT application (it's not a plugin), whenever I say dialog.open() I get the following: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.ui.PlatformUI.getWorkbench(PlatformUI.java:41) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.MessageLine.findImage(MessageLine.java:50) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.MessageLine.setErrorStatus (MessageLine.java:68) at org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.SelectionStatusDialog.updateStatus (SelectionStatusDialog.java:108) at org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.ElementTreeSelectionDialog.updateOKStatus (ElementTreeSelectionDialog.java:163) at org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.ElementTreeSelectionDialog$2.selectionChanged (ElementTreeSelectionDialog.java:258) at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.Viewer.fireSelectionChanged (Viewer.java:147) at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.updateSelection (StructuredViewer.java:1155) at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.handleSelect (StructuredViewer.java:544) at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer$1.widgetSelected (StructuredViewer.java:568) at org.eclipse.jface.util.OpenStrategy.fireSelectionEvent (OpenStrategy.java:171) at org.eclipse.jface.util.OpenStrategy.access$3(OpenStrategy.java:168) at org.eclipse.jface.util.OpenStrategy$1.handleEvent (OpenStrategy.java:297) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:77) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:827) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java:1529) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1291) at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.runEventLoop(Window.java:562) at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.open(Window.java:542) at org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.ElementTreeSelectionDialog.access$superOpen (ElementTreeSelectionDialog.java:188) at org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.ElementTreeSelectionDialog.access$0 (ElementTreeSelectionDialog.java:187) at org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.ElementTreeSelectionDialog$1.run (ElementTreeSelectionDialog.java:180) at org.eclipse.swt.custom.BusyIndicator.showWhile(BusyIndicator.java:66) at org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.ElementTreeSelectionDialog.open (ElementTreeSelectionDialog.java:178) at myapp.dialogs.MyWizardPage1$5.widgetSelected(MyWizardPage1.java:156) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TypedListener.handleEvent (TypedListener.java:87) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:77) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:827) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java:1529) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1291) at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.runEventLoop(Window.java:562) at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.open(Window.java:542) at myapp.ui.dialogs.MainClass.open(MainClass.java:33) at myapp.ui.dialogs.MainClass.main(MainClass.java:18)
I think what happening is that because the intial value of MySelectionDialog is invalid, the ISelectionStatusValidator is trying to bring up the ERROR image that is associated with the workbench. However, since my application is a stand- alone one, there is no workench. The workbench is designed to work inside eclipse as a plugin and as the main eclipse aplication. The plugin org.eclipse.ui is being devided in several plugins. Some of them (jface for example) may be used in a standalone aplication but some (workbench for example) are disigned to be used inside eclipse. I.E. you can't use ElementTreeSelectionDialog in your standalone application because it is part of the workbench.
Closing as invalid. Please reopen if it that is not what you are trying to do. Is it possible to make this a requestment for enhancment? This is a very useful dialog that should be available outside of a plugin. Since it's been already written, why should we reinvent the wheel?
Thanks!

Bug.Summery: [CVS UI] Commit comment dialog alternatives

Lines.Line: 1) developers want to put different comments for differnt group of changes they
made. Using tortoiseCVS, commit on root dir and pick the group of files and put
the comments and commit them. Repeat that process for other group of changes.
2) developers may only want to commit some of their changes to CVS and the
changes are spreaded over a few places (ejbs, descriptors, servlets etc). In
stead of going into each place and commit the changes, they simply do a commit
on project root dir and using tortoiseCVS to pick the files they want to check
in.
> Is this because scrolling through the files helps you build the comment
> somehow? I am interested in what work flow you are envisioning.
- open synchronize view
- open a separate editor (notepad/kwrite)
- inspect changes and write commit comment in separate editor
- open commit dialog, paste in commit message
- press OK :)

Bug.WithStack:
I recall that there was an enhancement report for displaying the list of items that are about to be committed to allow the user to both see the set of items to be committed, and to allow them to untoggle those they don't mean to.
Presently we show the list of unadded resources that can be checked off to be committed.
These two can be combined: by showing the list of resources that are to be committed (with checkbox column), with label decorator to indicate those that are new. New ones that are checked will be added and committed.
On a related note, it would be good if the list was a table where first column was checkbox, second resource name, and third resource path. Currently second is path but paths are hard to read and put the important info at the end. I would like an alternative to the modal dialogue. I would like to be able to write my comment and scroll through the file/files about to be committed. Ideally, it would be another frame in the view, this would be alow one to change the size and shape of the editting area. >>I would like to be able to write my comment and scroll through the file/files about to be committed.
Is this because scrolling through the files helps you build the comment somehow? I am interested in what work flow you are envisioning. *** Bug 60062 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 43395 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** For a reference gui design, look at how tortoiseCVS is implemented. I believe a lot of guys are still using tortoriseCVS along with Eclipse just becuase of lack of this feature in eclipse. Kevin McGuire asks (2003-01-09 18:01):
-Is this because scrolling through the files helps you build the -comment somehow? I am interested in what work flow you are envisioning.
It has been ruled that bug 43395 is a duplicate of 23765.
43395 is a request to let me scroll through the "changes" I'm about to check- in, i.e., the diffs. I want to peruse these changes so I can document them accurately as part of the check-in. My memory is not perfect, especially if I've had the files checked-out for a while or if I've made complex changes to many files. I want to make sure that the person trying to understand my check- in has a reasonable chance. Especially if that person is me 3 years from now.
Two reasons:
1) developers want to put different comments for differnt group of changes they made. Using tortoiseCVS, commit on root dir and pick the group of files and put the comments and commit them. Repeat that process for other group of changes.
2) developers may only want to commit some of their changes to CVS and the changes are spreaded over a few places (ejbs, descriptors, servlets etc). In stead of going into each place and commit the changes, they simply do a commit on project root dir and using tortoiseCVS to pick the files they want to check in. > Is this because scrolling through the files helps you build the comment > somehow? I am interested in what work flow you are envisioning.
Yes! I don't know what the optimal workflow would be, but just being able to scroll the current diff editor window up and down, while having the commit dialog open would be a huge improvement.
My current workflow is as follows: - open synchronize view - open a separate editor (notepad/kwrite) - inspect changes and write commit comment in separate editor - open commit dialog, paste in commit message - press OK :)
This has been resolved by new support in 3.1 for: 1. change sets in the synchronize view. You can write comments and then group files into their respective change sets. The sets are persisted at shutdown. This allows you to write comments and assign files to change sets as you develop. 2. the commit wizard shows the files that will be committed. this includes outgoing deletions. You can remove files from the commit at this point and inspect the files to write the commit comment. fix released to M4.

Bug.Summery: [CVS UI] Commit comment dialog: odd behaviour when selecting a new resource
Bug.WithStack:
If you select a new unadded resource and select "Commit", the new commit comment dialog with the file list/checkboxes will have the selected file in the list but it won't be checked.
The result is if you just hit <return> (OK), nothing will happen. We should probably check those that were directly selected. Fix released to HEAD and 2.1 M1
Bug.WithOutStack:
If you select a new unadded resource and select "Commit", the new commit comment dialog with the file list/checkboxes will have the selected file in the list but it won't be checked.
The result is if you just hit <return> (OK), nothing will happen. We should probably check those that were directly selected. Fix released to HEAD and 2.1 M1

Bug.Summery: Navigator should treat Jar files like directories.
Bug.WithStack:
I often need to see what classes are in a particular jar file from the Navigator. I would be nice if the Navigator would treat Jar files like directories such that expanding a Jar node would display other nodes, where packages are equivalent to directories and class files equivalent to files. The more general case is to handle Zip files.
Thank you for considering this request, Gary There are currently no plans to work on this feature

I often need to see what classes are in a particular jar file from the Navigator. I would be nice if the Navigator would treat Jar files like directories such that expanding a Jar node would display other nodes, where packages are equivalent to directories and class files equivalent to files. The more general case is to handle Zip files.
Thank you for considering this request, Gary There are currently no plans to work on this feature

Bug.Summery: [CVS UI] User not prompted to refresh in all cases
Bug.WithStack:
Code was added to the UI actions to prompt the user if any sync files were out of sync. This only happens if the sync info for the resources involved were not already loaded. If the info was already loaded, the "resource out of sync" error will happen if and when CVS tries to update the contents of the out-of- sync file. We do not prompt to refresh at this point. Also, we do not prompt to refresh if the resources themselves are out of sync (i.e. we only lok at the files in the CVS folders). (Copied from bug 23831)
When i touch a file outside eclipse and i don't do a refresh but directly a Replace with->latest from Repository. i will get an error and suddenly the file is marked as not in cvs.
ibuild of 0918
The same is for most compare things:
Replace with->Revision and then select one (to compare) : Internal error
same with:
Compare with->Reveision (but i thinkg that is the same code)
compare with->REpository edition is going ok because he ask to refresh. *** Bug 23831 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** This bug has not been touched in 2 years. Closing as WONTFIX. If you feel this bug is important, feel free to reopen it.

Bug.Summery: [CVS Repo View] Check Out as Project/Check Out As... confusion

Lines.Line: 1. checks for absent .project and prompts for project type
2. suggests name based on folder name, allows name to be changed, handles name
conflict case as we do currently
3. allows you to modify the proposed project name
4. provides a "Finish" button that just takes the defaults for #2, #3
*** Bug 23567 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Although not a duplicate, bug 23688 is related to this. It is a request to use
the project name in .project as the local project name when checing out a
project.
*** Bug 25677 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 26718 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Since (it appears to me) there is no way to set a project type on an existing
project, I consider one part of this particularly important - "Check out as
Project" should prompt for the project type if no .project exists.
- doesn't suggest project name according to folder name selected in repo view
- only works on single selection

Bug.WithStack: The differences between "Check Out As Project" and "Check Out As..." seem arbitrary and confusing. Check Out As Project - doesn't prompt for project type if no .project + project name is based on folder name + works on multiple selection + prompts for name if name already exists (suggests "Copy of xxxx") Check Out As + prompts for project type if no .project - doesn't suggest project name according to folder name selected in repo view - only works on single selection Suggest we have a single "Checkout" which 1. checks for absent .project and prompts for project type 2. suggests name based on folder name, allows name to be changed, handles name conflict case as we do currently 3. allows you to modify the proposed project name 4. provides a "Finish" button that just takes the defaults for #2, #3 *** Bug 23567 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Although not a duplicate, bug 23688 is related to this. It is a request to use the project name in .project as the local project name when checing out a project. *** Bug 25677 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 26718 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Since (it appears to me) there is no way to set a project type on an existing project, I consider one part of this particularly important - "Check out as Project" should prompt for the project type if no .project exists. The only workaround I have found is to delete the project, but not the contents, create a new project to look at the old contents, and share the project. Cheers, Dave. Thhas been fixed in 3.0 M2. There are now only two menu items: CheckouT and Checkout As. Checkout performs what Chechout as Project or Checkout Module did (i.e. only prompting to overwrite) while Checkout As prestns the user with the various choices (change name, configure, chakout into, etc.). I realize this is a very old bug, but it keeps coming up that the behavior of Check Out is confusing. This bug requests an enhancement that Check Out would prompt for the project type if there is no .project file. Can we get this re-opened to consider implementing that feature? Does bug 73590 cover your request? (In reply to comment #8) > Does bug 73590 cover your request? > Yes, that one sounds like a good alternative. I've added another suggestion to bug 73590. Check Out As should be a default (offered) step and this can be achieved by making the Next button (of the CVS checkout dialogs) in-focus by default, rather than the Finish button in-focus. Doing this will help to reduce the confusion.
Bug.WithOutStack: The differences between "Check Out As Project" and "Check Out As..." seem arbitrary and confusing. Check Out As Project - doesn't prompt for project type if no .project + project name is based on folder name + works on multiple selection + prompts for name if name already exists (suggests "Copy of xxxx") Check Out As + prompts for project type if no .project - doesn't suggest project name according to folder name selected in repo view - only works on single selection Suggest we have a single "Checkout" which 1. checks for absent .project and prompts for project type 2. suggests name based on folder name, allows name to be changed, handles name conflict case as we do currently 3. allows you to modify the proposed project name 4. provides a "Finish" button that just takes the defaults for #2, #3 *** Bug 23567 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Although not a duplicate, bug 23688 is related to this. It is a request to use the project name in .project as the local project name when checing out a project. *** Bug 25677 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 26718 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Since (it appears to me) there is no way to set a project type on an existing project, I consider one part of this particularly important - "Check out as Project" should prompt for the project type if no .project exists. The only workaround I have found is to delete the project, but not the contents, create a new project to look at the old contents, and share the project. Cheers, Dave. Thhas been fixed in 3.0 M2. There are now only two menu items: CheckouT and Checkout As. Checkout performs what Chechout as Project or Checkout Module did (i.e. only prompting to overwrite) while Checkout As prestns the user with the various choices (change name, configure, chakout into, etc.). I realize this is a very old bug, but it keeps coming up that the behavior of Check Out is confusing. This bug requests an enhancement that Check Out would prompt for the project type if there is no .project file. Can we get this re-opened to consider implementing that feature? Does bug 73590 cover your request? (In reply to comment #8) > Does bug 73590 cover your request? > Yes, that one sounds like a good alternative. I've added another suggestion to bug 73590. Check Out As should be a default (offered) step and this can be achieved by making the Next button (of the CVS checkout dialogs) in-focus by default, rather than the Finish button in-focus. Doing this will help to reduce the confusion.

build 20020917

When I synchronize with the repository I get an incoming conflict ("override and update" is enabled) with the nodes Playground_Knut kr test
in the tree viewer. Below the "test" node there is a node without label and icon. It only has the placeholder space for an icon. There's also an empty item when I switch to outgoing mode. Can you give some indication as to the steps you performed leading up to the error. Was there anything in the log? Also, were there conflict indicators on the folders? Could you provide a screenshot of the problem? Created attachment 2014 log file after synchronizing Now that I looked at the log file I remembered that I hacked the files in one of the CVS subdirectories in order to reproduce some obscure resource out of sync bug. I didn't restore the good ones so strange CVS behavior is to be expected. Everything works now. Sorry for the waste of time. The NPE caused no lable to be provided. We should add a in the getText of the label provider for a null binding and return the original text label. Fix released to HEAD

Bug.Summery: [TM] Compare With>Filesystem
Bug.WithStack:
Often, when I want to compare a file (call it A) with another version (call that B), it's much easier for me to remember the old workspace where that version is located (i.e. where the corresponding file is in filespace) than it is for me to determine what its version ID is. So I drag A into Emacs, open B in another buffer, and ediff-buffers.
It would be nicer if I could just select A, rclick>Compare With>Filesystem, browse to B, and use your pretty comparison display. Dup of bug 21817? Target Management is currently not being actively developed or maintained. Bug 21817 is now more about three-way compare. I will update its summary accordingly. This one looks more like bug 73923 to me.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 73923 ***

Bug.Summery: [Properties dialog] Project Properties -> Info page should not use text fields

Lines.Line: - select a Project, right-click -> Properties
- on the subsequent Info page the read-only fields (the values for Path, Type,
etc.) are created as read-only Text fields instead of Labels. I guess this is
so that their values can be selected and copied by the user (?)
- this looks fine on windows, but on motif these text fields all get automatic
borders, which identify them as user input targets. Additionally, on
Solaris/AIX/HP-UX these fields have different coloured backgrounds which make
them stand out much worse
Created attachment 2186
Output for R2.0.1, no borders
Created attachment 2187
R2.1, borders
The text widget is used for navigation purposes, we must traverse to these
values. If this were not the case then we would use the label widget.

Bug.WithStack:
Integration build 09/17. Looks bad on all motif platforms.
- select a Project, right-click -> Properties - on the subsequent Info page the read-only fields (the values for Path, Type, etc.) are created as read-only Text fields instead of Labels. I guess this is so that their values can be selected and copied by the user (?) - this looks fine on windows, but on motif these text fields all get automatic borders, which identify them as user input targets. Additionally, on Solaris/AIX/HP-UX these fields have different coloured backgrounds which make them stand out much worse Created attachment 2186 Output for R2.0.1, no borders Created attachment 2187 R2.1, borders The text widget is used for navigation purposes, we must traverse to these values. If this were not the case then we would use the label widget.
I have attached two screenshots, one from R2.0.1 and one from R2.1 (motif). In the R2.1 case the behaviour you described is evident. In the R2.0.1 case the behaviour is not evident, it looks like the behaviour shown on windows.
What has changed in R2.1 such that the text widget no longer displays the same as it did in R2.0 and R2.0.1?
The code used to generate the output is also attached Created attachment 2188 File used to create previous two snapshots Nothing has changed.
When you specify a border, the text widget provides one. This may also mean that it adds extra space above and below the text. This space different, depending on the platform. Notice that when you open a native file dialog, the text field has a border and the same spacing.
When you don't specify a border, SWT doesn't include a border and removes the extra space. This is done natively on Windows, probably so that in-line text editors "look good". It is emulated elsewhere.
So, there's nothing for us to do. Moving back to UI. Perhaps the dialog should be layed out differently? A question for no one in particular: Why do the label values need to be traversable? They're never editable.
I have attached a simpler example TestText2.java. What I found was that if I use SWT.WRAP then the appearance of the text changes, I get a 3D effect on motif. This was not the case in R2.0.1 or R2.0 (motif)
I have attached the output from running this code. Created attachment 2201 Illustrate effect of SWT.WRAP Created attachment 2202 output from TestText2 Traversal of the path and location widgets is required for accessibility. Without a mouse users may still wish to select this text and copy it somewhere else, say a PR for example. Change your code to get rid of the SWT.WRAP flag. When you specify SWT.WRAP, you are no longer creating a single line text widget. I now understand what is going on. The new GTK text widget always draws a border.
So, you can fix Eclipse by getting rid of the SWT.WRAP flag but SWT still has a problem.
SSQ to investigate and advise. Fixed > 20030528.

Bug.Summery: Java compiler doesn't properly flag invalid protected access (for javac 1.4 compatibility)
Bug.WithStack:
According to: http://developer.java.sun.com/developer/bugParade/bugs/4637755.html for a Java 1.4 compatible javac the compiler should not allow access to protected members from classes defined outside their package, even if members are overrider the method from a base class that *is* in the accessor's package. This "bug" existed in the javac included with JDK 1.3, but is "fixed" in the JDK 1.4 javac.
Included is a piece of sample code that demonstrates the problem. With Sun's javac from JDK1.4 the following error is reported on compilation:
PackageA/MainClass.java:12: overriddenMethod() has protected access in PackageB.DerivedClass derivedObject.overriddenMethod();
Eclipse's java compiler compiles the code happily, even when JDK1.4 compatibility is enabled. Created attachment 2009 Tiny eclipse project demonstrating the problem I should mention that the attachment *does* compile with Eclipse, but it should not. I've commented the line that should not compile. Works for me in latest. This is a duplicate of bug 22428. Fix is part of 2.1-M1 build.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 22428 *** Forgot to assign.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 22428 ***

Bug.Summery: GTK tree display problem
Bug.WithStack:
I get a display problem with trees. I cannot reproduce the problem.
It looked like the content of the tree was duplicated each the tree was refreshed (i.e.: when I switched between editors).
See the result in the attached file. Created attachment 2010 The result after 15 minutes ... Thanks Luc. Hopefully this goes away when we move to the new GTK widgets. I still get the problem from time to time, and when I get it, I get "bind fail, no free callback slot *******" many times in the console where I launch Eclipse.
May be it's not directly related to the tree, and the display problem is just the visible part of the problem.
We are well on our way of replacing the deprecated widgets: today we have the new Table and the new Text, with Tree coming in a few days. As the new Tree is in place, we should watch if this ever happens in the newer builds. The new Tree and Table widgets have been released (build 20021022 and later). I have not seen this problem in the new implementation. I am to going to close this bug. Note: check bug#25212 for more info.
The no more callbacks problem is addressed by Bug#24055.

Bug.Summery: [CVS Core] Commit of empty folder should not delete it from workspace

Lines.Line: 1. ensure "Prune Empty Directories" is on (should be by default)
2. in an already shared project, create an empty directory
3. add it to vc
4. commit it.

Bug.WithStack:
1. ensure "Prune Empty Directories" is on (should be by default) 2. in an already shared project, create an empty directory 3. add it to vc 4. commit it.
*Poof* its deleted from workspace.
Presumably what we meant to do was simply not commit the empty folders. We may also want a different preference for this since its non-standard CVS. Actually, it turns out we commit the empty ones, and then delete them, which is the worst combination. Fix released to HEAD
Bug.WithOutStack:
1. ensure "Prune Empty Directories" is on (should be by default) 2. in an already shared project, create an empty directory 3. add it to vc 4. commit it.
*Poof* its deleted from workspace.
Presumably what we meant to do was simply not commit the empty folders. We may also want a different preference for this since its non-standard CVS. Actually, it turns out we commit the empty ones, and then delete them, which is the worst combination. Fix released to HEAD

Bug.Summery: [build] Nested Features
Bug.WithStack:
There has been interest expressed in having nested features. Dean please comment. The feature specification defines nested features. These features are used to describe the various SDKs that we build and are used by the Update site to organize and present data. (The windwos SDK feature contains platform, JDT and PDE for esxample).
However, PDE can build a regular feature but not a nested features. This means thar our build scripts must mimic the nested structure of the top level features. This is very hard to maintian.
It would be a big win for us if PDE-BUILD could generate the required build.xml files for building nested features. The support for the nested feature has been implemented.
Code from local repository merged into dev.eclipse.org. Closing.
Bug.WithOutStack:
There has been interest expressed in having nested features. Dean please comment. The feature specification defines nested features. These features are used to describe the various SDKs that we build and are used by the Update site to organize and present data. (The windwos SDK feature contains platform, JDT and PDE for esxample).
However, PDE can build a regular feature but not a nested features. This means thar our build scripts must mimic the nested structure of the top level features. This is very hard to maintian.
It would be a big win for us if PDE-BUILD could generate the required build.xml files for building nested features. The support for the nested feature has been implemented.
Code from local repository merged into dev.eclipse.org. Closing.

Bug.Summery: Error running simple Junit test [JUnit]

Lines.Line: 1) Open a new workspace.
2) Create a java project, add junit.jar to build path
3) Create a simple Junit test case.
4) Try to run using JUnit launch configuration

Bug.WithStack:
Build 20020717 (2.1 stream)
1) Open a new workspace. 2) Create a java project, add junit.jar to build path 3) Create a simple Junit test case. 4) Try to run using JUnit launch configuration
It fails to run. The following appears in the console:
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/jdt/internal/junit/runner/RemoteTestRunner Exception in thread "main" I had the same problem in version 2.0 when starting eclipse with command line argument "-dev". Without that test execution works. not clear whether both problems are caused by an incorrect use of -dev.
However, since others got trapped by -dev I've changed the code so that independent of -dev both the output folder and the JAR are on the build class path.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Build 20020717 (2.1 stream)
1) Open a new workspace. 2) Create a java project, add junit.jar to build path 3) Create a simple Junit test case. 4) Try to run using JUnit launch configuration
It fails to run. The following appears in the console:
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/jdt/internal/junit/runner/RemoteTestRunner Exception in thread "main" I had the same problem in version 2.0 when starting eclipse with command line argument "-dev". Without that test execution works. not clear whether both problems are caused by an incorrect use of -dev.
However, since others got trapped by -dev I've changed the code so that independent of -dev both the output folder and the JAR are on the build class path.

Bug.Summery: [CVS Core] Empty directories always pruned in sync

Lines.Line: 1. Turn off "Prune empty directories" pref
2. create a project with empty dirs
3. commit them
4. delete the empty dirs
5. sync the project

Bug.WithStack:
1. Turn off "Prune empty directories" pref 2. create a project with empty dirs 3. commit them 4. delete the empty dirs 5. sync the project
In the sync view you don't see the folders as incomming changes. You should, since they aren't local and you are not prunning. Also, if you delete the empty directories then sync, it says that resources are the same (which they aren't, since you are missing the empty dirs and aren't prunning). Fix released to HEAD
Bug.WithOutStack:
1. Turn off "Prune empty directories" pref 2. create a project with empty dirs 3. commit them 4. delete the empty dirs 5. sync the project
In the sync view you don't see the folders as incomming changes. You should, since they aren't local and you are not prunning. Also, if you delete the empty directories then sync, it says that resources are the same (which they aren't, since you are missing the empty dirs and aren't prunning). Fix released to HEAD

Build 20020917
Was running Eclipse. Used the new backward/forward buttons some, closed all perspectives, opened Java Perspective, browsed code, etc. Got the following walkback when I exited. Don't know how to reproduce.
!SESSION Sep 18, 2002 16:50:17.574 -------------------------------------------- - java.fullversion=J2RE 1.3.0 IBM build cn130-20010502 (JIT enabled: jitc) BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US Command-line arguments: -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -dev bin -data d:\eclipse-ws\ui-ws -firstuse -install file:D:/eclipse/ !ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Sep 18, 2002 16:50:17.574 !MESSAGE Unhandled exception caught in event loop. !ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Sep 18, 2002 16:50:17.625 !MESSAGE Widget is disposed !STACK 0 !ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 2 Sep 18, 2002 17:19:24.406 !MESSAGE Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: "org.eclipse.ui". !STACK 0
It looks like you opened the help menu and before the show menu event was processed the workbench got closed and the menu got disposed. Near impossible to reproduce. I will talk to SN since I think we should not get the event at that point. Moving to SWT. I think we should not get an show/hide event if the menu is disposed. KeyBindingMenu is the hidden menu for the keybinding. Steve, please investigate and advise. Eduardo and Lynne, I haven't heard of this one for a while. Please reopen if it happens again. Thanks.

Bug.Summery: Inaccurate Help Search
Bug.WithStack:
Open the the Help window and type "container" into the search field. Click the Go button. The results of the search includes references to the word "contain" and "contains", which is clearly wrong. I'd expect references to words starting with "container", eg: "container" and "containers", etc.
See the attached screen shot. Created attachment 2013 Screenshot "Container", "contain", and "contains" have a common word root. Search is not searching for substrings. Search finds all words that have the same root as the word you search for. It is a feature that we are able to find those.
If you want exact word "container", enclose the word in double quotes. The side effect of this "feature" is that you get WAY more hits that you want. Seaching for the word "contains" (without quotes) yields approximatly 300 hits, most of which are just plan wrong.
At a minimum, this funky word root stuff should be a checkbox under "Advanced" seach dialog. The Law of Least Astonishment is worth following.
BTW, using Eclipse 2.0.1, I just tested adding double-quotes and it does absolutely NOTHING. The results are the same for seaching with an unquoted expression. Again, see the screenshot.
Created attachment 2015 screenshot It is subjective how search should behave. Some users might not expect and like it, but user assistance experts tell us using stemming is a preferred way. Finding more documents than needed usually hurts less than finding no results at all.
You might want to open a feature (can modify this bug) to have a stemming (de) selectable in the search UI, preferences or somewhere.
The exact search is not in 2.0.1 so do not test double quoted search in these build. The 20020917 in HEAD stream is the first build with correct behavior of double quoted search, and today's rebuild will also have improvements to highlighting words in resulting documents. Thanks Konrad for your clarification. I shall open another PR requesting that stemming be an option. While I totally agree that "more hits" if probably better than "less hits", the results are sometimes difficult to wade through, especially when there is >300 of them.
When I use web search engines, such as www.hotbot.com, I start by searching for an "Exact Phrase", and then narrow the hits by searching again WITHIN my previous search results. I find this yeilds the most accurate hits. To narrow your results, just add more terms (do not have to use AND since it is a default), and repeat the search. Our search is fast enough that you can use this and do not need search within. Please see the new feature request PR. http://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=23869

Bug.Summery: imported schemas are not found
Bug.WithStack:
The library does not find schemas imported by a main schema even when a schema location is specified. To reproduce this error, simply invoke the printSchema(URL ) method of org.eclipse.xsd.util.XSDPrototypicalSchema with the location of the attached main schema (twoNamespaces.xsd) as the only parameter. The XSD library issues the following warning : "Warning: URI file:///C:\Documents and Settings\achille\My Documents\IBM\wsad\workspace\Testcases\XP4XSD\twoNamespaces\twoNamespaces.xsd Line 5 Column 2"
twoNamespaces.xsd :
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <xsd:schema targetNamespace="http://twoNamespacse.com/ns/1" xmlns:t="http://twoNamespaces.com/ns/2" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xsd:import namespace="http://twoNamespaces.com/ns/2" schemaLocation="twoNamespaces2.xsd"/> <xsd:element name="book"> <xsd:complexType > <xsd:sequence > <xsd:element ref="t:titleA"/> <xsd:element ref="t:titleB"/> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute fixed="US" id="at-decl-attrA" name="attrA" type="xsd:string"/> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:schema>
twoNamespaces2.xsd (located in the same directory as the main schema):
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <xsd:schema xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" targetNamespace="http://twoNamespaces.com/ns/2" xmlns:t="http://twoNamespaces.com/ns/2"> <xsd:element name="titleA" type="xsd:string" id="el-decl-2-titleA"> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="titleB" type="xsd:string" id="el-decl-2-titleB"> </xsd:element> </xsd:schema> Achille, a backslash is not intepretted as a path separtor in a URI. If you are starting with a java.io.File path, using URI.createFileURI to create a file: URI would be highly recommended. It will take a path acceptable to java.io.File and turn it into a properly formed URI.

The library does not find schemas imported by a main schema even when a schema location is specified. To reproduce this error, simply invoke the printSchema(URL ) method of org.eclipse.xsd.util.XSDPrototypicalSchema with the location of the attached main schema (twoNamespaces.xsd) as the only parameter. The XSD library issues the following warning : "Warning: URI file:///C:\Documents and Settings\achille\My Documents\IBM\wsad\workspace\Testcases\XP4XSD\twoNamespaces\twoNamespaces.xsd Line 5 Column 2"
twoNamespaces.xsd :
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <xsd:schema targetNamespace="http://twoNamespacse.com/ns/1" xmlns:t="http://twoNamespaces.com/ns/2" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xsd:import namespace="http://twoNamespaces.com/ns/2" schemaLocation="twoNamespaces2.xsd"/> <xsd:element name="book"> <xsd:complexType > <xsd:sequence > <xsd:element ref="t:titleA"/> <xsd:element ref="t:titleB"/> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute fixed="US" id="at-decl-attrA" name="attrA" type="xsd:string"/> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:schema>
twoNamespaces2.xsd (located in the same directory as the main schema):
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <xsd:schema xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" targetNamespace="http://twoNamespaces.com/ns/2" xmlns:t="http://twoNamespaces.com/ns/2"> <xsd:element name="titleA" type="xsd:string" id="el-decl-2-titleA"> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="titleB" type="xsd:string" id="el-decl-2-titleB"> </xsd:element> </xsd:schema> Achille, a backslash is not intepretted as a path separtor in a URI.
